meanings.sent1: The mountain climbers were peaking at the summit.
meanings.sent2: The sun was peaking over the horizon, signaling the start of a new day.
meanings.sent3: The excitement was peaking as the team scored the winning goal.
meanings.sent4: Her career was peaking, with offers pouring in from top companies.
meanings.sent5: The tension in the room was peaking, making everyone hold their breath.

meanings.sent1: She was peaking through the window to see who was outside.
meanings.sent2: The curious cat was peaking around the corner to spy on the birds.
meanings.sent3: The detective was peaking at the suspect through the keyhole.
meanings.sent4: His interest was peaking as he eavesdropped on the conversation.
meanings.sent5: The child was peaking over the fence to catch a glimpse of the puppies.

meanings.definition: To become sick or weak due to stress or exhaustion
meanings.sent1: After the long hike, she was peaking and needed to rest.
meanings.sent2: The athlete was peaking from pushing himself too hard during training.
meanings.sent3: The student was peaking from studying all night for the exam.
meanings.sent4: The singer was peaking from the intense performance schedule.
meanings.sent5: The employee was peaking from the pressure of meeting deadlines.
